text: Greetings! As your ZOLL BILLING Assistant, I'm here to provide dedicated support for any inquiries or issues you may encounter regarding help content related to ZOLL Billing. Please feel free to reach out at any time. I'm readily available to assist you!

ZOLL Billing reports are a way to view information about your transactions, payments, and claims. For example, the Projected Revenue report calculates the revenue of closed claims to determine projected revenue across open claims. The Payments and Revenue reports also calculate the revenue of closed claims. The Trip Reconciliation report reconciles claims in Billing against trips in your patient care system to ensure that all trips have, or will, be billed.

text.text: What should I do after moving an account to collections and sending the "Send to collections" report to my collections agency?

text: Once you receive a payment for an account in collections, use the following steps to post the payment in your ZOLL Billing system: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Payments and click Payments. 2. Click Create a transaction. 3. Enter the payment information: In the "Payer" field, enter the collection agency name that sent you the payment. 4. Click Post transaction.

text.text: Where do I hover over to start posting a collections payment?

text: To start posting a collections payment, you need to hover over Payments and click Payments.

text.text: What should I click on after hovering over Payments on the navigation bar?

text: To start posting a collections payment, you need to hover over Payments and click Payments. Then, you need to click Create a transaction and enter the payment information: In the "Payer" field, enter the collection agency name that sent you the payment. Finally, you need to click Post transaction.

text.text: In the "Payer" field, what information should I enter when posting a collections payment?

text: In the "Payer" field, you should enter the collection agency name that sent you the payment.

text.text: What should I enter in the Account # field?

text: In the Account # field, you should enter the patient account number (first five-to-six digits of the claim number).

text.text: How should I handle the "Amount collected" and "Collections fee" fields when entering payment information?

text: In the "Amount collected" field, you should enter the total amount collected by the collection agency in the “Amount collected” field before any fees were adjusted. Then add the amount of the "Collections fee" your agency paid to the collection agency, which will give you the amount in your "Line item amount" field.

text.text: What formula should I use to determine the "Line item amount"?

text: The formula for the "Line item amount" is: "Amount collected" – "Collection fee" = "Line item amount".

text.text: What should I do once the amount is fully allocated?

text: Once the amount is fully allocated, you should click the Post transaction button at the bottom right corner of your payment screen. If there is only one claim on your collections payment, you are done and you can.

text.text: If there are multiple patient accounts on the collections payment, what should I click to post additional accounts?

text: If there are multiple patient accounts listed on the collection agency payment, you should click the Add a line item button. This will open a new page where you can enter the information for the next account you received payment for.

text.text: What should I do after entering all the payments for multiple accounts and I'm ready to post the transaction?

text: When all payments have been allocated, you can click Finish later to review the information you just posted or, if you are ready to post, click Post transaction.

text.text: How do I post a payment in Zoll Billing system?

text: To post a payment in Zoll Billing system, you can use the following steps: 1. On the navigation bar, hover over Payments and click Payments. 2. Click Create a transaction. 3. Enter the payment information: In the "Payer" field, enter the collection agency name that sent you the payment.

text.text: What should I do when there are multiple patient accounts listed on the collection agency payment?

text: If there is only one claim on your collections payment, you are done and you can. If there are multiple patient accounts listed on the collection agency payment, you should click the Add a line item button. This will open a new page where you can enter the information for the next account you received payment for.
